*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to James F. Perry, March 6, 1832. Leaving instructions on departure for Saltillo.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**date_mentioned n="03-06-1832">March 6 1832*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr *person_mentioned*brother*/person_mentioned**/p*
I send you *person_mentioned*Simon */person_mentioned*and wish you to keep him close at work until I return. He has been idle so long that he will require a tight rein— he is in the habit of gambling—-but he is a useful hand on a farm if he is kept close to his business. I wish you to send for the Mares and Colts of mine at *location_mentioned**person_mentioned*John P. Cole*/person_mentioned*s*/location_mentioned* they will be fat—sell them or keep them as you please, I do not know how many there is of them— I have given the deed for the place you are on to *person_mentioned*Emily*/person_mentioned* there is a *location_mentioned*league and three quarters instead of a league and a half. */location_mentioned*I have left my will with*person_mentioned* S. M. Williams.*/person_mentioned* You are one of the *person_mentioned*executors */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*H. Austin*/person_mentioned* the other.
*p*Don't neglect to have a good *location_mentioned*orchard */location_mentioned*under way and by *date_mentioned n="Fall-18132">next fall*/date_mentioned* have a good sail boat for the *location_mentioned*bay */location_mentioned*to go oystering and fishing I can spend some time with you next fall and winter. I have left a bundle of notes with *person_mentioned*Hunter*/person_mentioned*—try and get Cows as many as you can and young cattle—sell the horses for cattle—the more cows the better*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Bell*/person_mentioned*s receipt and *person_mentioned*Sims*/person_mentioned* note are in the bundle I gave to *person_mentioned*Emily*/person_mentioned*. [Addressed:] *person_mentioned*James F. Perry */person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
